title: Functions
summary: A function is a reusable block of code that performs a specific task. Instead of repeating code, you define a function once and call it whenever needed. Functions help keep programs clean, organized, and modular.
sample_question: What is a function and why do we use it in programming?

title: Conditional Statements
summary: Conditional statements like if, else, and elif help programs make decisions. They run different blocks of code depending on whether a condition is true or false. This makes programs dynamic and responsive.
sample_question: What is an if-else statement? Explain how it helps a program make decisions.

title: Lists
summary: A list is a collection of values stored in a single variable. Items remain in order and can be accessed using index numbers. Lists are useful for storing related data like marks, names, or items in a cart.
sample_question: What is a list, and how do you access elements using indexes?
